intro: Drosanthemum littlewoodii, commonly known as the Littlewood's drosanthemum, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from yellow to orange, and it produces seeds in small, capsule-like structures. Drosanthemum littlewoodii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
